<meta name="title" content="What Is a Self-Driving Car?">
<meta name="description" content="These vehicles have sensory technology that helps drivers maintain lane control, speed, and safe following distance on the road.">
<meta name="keywords" content="">
<meta name="og:title" content="What Is a Self-Driving Car?" property="og:title">
<meta name="og:description" content="A self-driving car is a type of vehicle that does not need a person to operate it. Instead, It uses advanced sensory technology like lidar, sonar, GPS, radar, or odometry and inertial measurements to identify environmental changes and adapt to restore safe speed or distance." property="og:description">

var b="fetch"in window&&"assign"in Object;if(!b){var s=document.createElement("script");s.async=!1,s.src="https://assets.hearstapps.com/assets/dist/js/shared/polyfills.2d23c66.js",document.head.appendChild(s)}

"serviceWorker"in navigator&&navigator.serviceWorker.register("/sw.js").then(function(e){console.log("Service worker registration succeeded.")}).catch(function(e){console.warn("Service worker registration failed: "+e)});
</script><script type="application/json" id="data-layer">{"canonicalUrl":"https://www.caranddriver.com/research/a31996016/what-is-a-self-driving-car/","locale":{"language":"en-US","urlPath":""},"site":{"name":"Car and Driver","domain":"www.caranddriver.com","dartZone":"","icxSiteId":"10048"},"content":{"authors":["Car and Driver Research"],"adCategory":{"id":"cb7bce80-3061-4ff6-80c5-7340b31dac66","name":"Auto","prefix":"auto"},"autoSocial":"timely","contentType":"Default","collections":[],"createdDate":{"year":"2020","month":"03","day":"31","hour":"19","minute":"59"},"displayType":"Standard Article","display_id":"31996016","embeddedMedia":{"video":{"aol":0,"abcvideo":0,"funnyordie":0,"hulu":0,"kaltura":0,"mtv":0,"ndn":0,"tmz":0,"vevo":0,"vimeo":0,"video":0,"yahoo":0,"youtube":0},"music":{"soundcloud":0,"spotify":0},"quiz":{"playbuzz":0,"quizatious":0},"shop":{"commerce":0},"social":{"facebook":0,"instagram":0,"pinterest":0,"tiktok":0,"twitter":0,"vine":0},"poll":{"text":0}},"id":"8837c5cd-7a3f-469c-9828-9df4427c1770","universalId":"caranddriver.article.31996016","images":{"lede":{"width":5034,"height":3357,"thumb_url":"https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?crop=0.66687xw:1xh;center,top&resize=100:*","url":"https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg"},"social":{"width":5034,"height":3357,"thumb_url":"https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?crop=0.66687xw:1xh;center,top&resize=100:*","url":"https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg"}},"modifiedDate":{"year":"2020","month":"04","day":"13","hour":"14","minute":"47"},"selectedMedia":[],"publishDate":{"year":"2020","month":"04","day":"13","hour":"14","minute":"47"},"slug":"what-is-a-self-driving-car","sourceName":"Hearst Editorial","section":{"name":"Research","prefix":"research"},"subsection":{"name":"","prefix":""},"sponsor":[],"syndicationRights":"0","tags":[],"themes":["Automotive"],"title":"What Is a Self-Driving Car?","wordCount":1106},"template":"Standard Article","ogUrl":"https://www.caranddriver.com/research/a31996016/what-is-a-self-driving-car/"}</script>
<script type="application/ld+json" id="json-ld">{"@context":"http://schema.org","url":"https://www.caranddriver.com/research/a31996016/what-is-a-self-driving-car/","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Car and Driver","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://assets.hearstapps.com/sites/caranddriver/assets/images/logos/logo-jsonld.2cd62c6.png","width":312,"height":60}},"@type":"Article","author":{"name":"Car and Driver Research","@type":"Person"},"datePublished":"2020-04-13T14:47:04.720686Z","headline":"What Is a Self-Driving Car?","image":{"@type":"ImageObject","height":3357,"thumbnail":"https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?crop=0.66687xw:1xh;center,top&resize=100:*","url":"https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg","width":5034},"mainEntityOfPage":{"@id":"https://www.caranddriver.com/research/a31996016/what-is-a-self-driving-car/","@type":"WebPage"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?crop=0.66687xw:1xh;center,top&resize=100:*","articleBody":"A self-driving car is a type of vehicle that does not need a person to operate it. Instead, It uses advanced sensory technology like lidar, sonar, GPS, radar, or odometry and inertial measurements to identify environmental changes and adapt to restore safe speed or distance. Are There Self-driving Cars Legally in Operation Today? According to the Union of Concerned Scientists, as of 2020, there are no fully-autonomous vehicles in legal operation. Instead, partially-autonomous cars have become a cutting-edge option in the legal realm. These vehicles have sensory technology that helps drivers maintain lane control, speed, and safe following distance on the road. What is the History of Self-driving Cars? The history of self-driving cars mentioned in the Wall Street Journal goes back to the 1920s, where engineering professionals drew up plans for an automated driving system (ADS), with experiments starting as early as the 1950s. However, the first automated vehicle was not developed for testing until the 1970s by the Tsukuba Mechanical Engineering laboratory in Japan. This specially-constructed model had two cameras and an analog computer, which together worked to construct an image of the roadway ahead of them. However, the car only reached 19 miles an hour and it had support from an elevated rail. Throughout the 1980s the United States' Defense Advanced Research Project Agency (DARPA) funded several university research initiatives involving the development of automated vehicles and their experimentation. In 1991 the United States gave $650 million in funds towards the National Automated Highway System. This experimental system used special technology placed in the ground to guide automated vehicles along a stretch of road. Despite the program's successful completion in 1997, there was no clear direction for the future of self-driving cars and their place in transportation. Fast-forward to 2015, Delphi took self-driving to another level. Using Delphi technology, engineers were able to apply improved methods to an Audi model and the vehicle \"self-drove,\" over 5,000 miles. What Are the Differences in Terminology Used to Describe Self-driving Cars Within the Industry? There are several differences in terminology that experts use to describe self-driving cars within the industry, as each organization has its way of defining automated vehicles. The BBC states that these inconsistencies can present certain dangers to the public through confusing or misleading advertisements about a new model and its level of autonomy. These are the terms you might come across in your research and how they are different from one another: Autonomous: Autonomous is used to refer to something that is self-governing, meaning something that can act on its own without help. Autonomous control: Autonomous control refers to an object's ability to operate solely by itself, using built-in technology to anticipate problems and adjust to prevent them from occurring, without help from an outside force. This term gets used a lot when describing vehicles with self-driving capabilities. Automated vehicle: When advertisements describe a car as an automated vehicle, this means that the vehicle can operate by itself for certain periods. However, there are limitations to its autonomy, which means that the driver should be alert and ready to take full control in situations that require manual assistance. Fully-Automated vehicle: When a car is said to be fully-automated, this means that it is fully capable of operating by itself, without the help of the driver. It is essential to understand the different meanings behind these similar but distinctive terms used to describe self-driving cars, so you can fully understand its limitations. What is a Classification System in Driving Automation? In driving automation, a classification system consists of five levels. These were first established in 2014 by SAE International to help distinguish a vehicle's level of autonomy , from fully-manual to fully automated. What Are the Levels of Driving Automation? The Union of Concerned Scientists outlines the levels of driving automation that distinguish a vehicle's ability to be fully autonomous. Here is each autonomy level and what it means if a vehicle is classified under it: Level 0 Level 0 describes any car whose automated system can give drivers warnings about collisions, speed, and other potentially hazardous conditions. However, the driver is in full control of the vehicle at all times. Level 1 Level 1 describes any vehicle that shares control with the driver. What this means is any vehicle that has cruise control, parking assistance, or lane assistance. In each case, the driver still needs to operate a portion of the car. With cruise control, they are still responsible for steering and braking when necessary. With parking assistance, drivers are responsible for applying the correct amount of braking and acceleration. Similarly, lane assistance allows the vehicle to take control of steering to an extent, while the driver is still responsible for maintaining speed and braking when necessary. Level 2 Level 2, also called \"hands-off,\" is used to describe any vehicle that is fully capable of operating itself. This includes braking, accelerating, and steering. However, the driver is still responsible for paying attention to their surroundings and should always be prepared to take back control when necessary. Many level 2 vehicles are also programmed only to operate when sensors detect the driver's hands on the steering wheel. Level 3 Level 3, also called \"eyes off,\" is used to describe any vehicle whose automated capabilities allow the driver to take their eyes off of the road for extended periods. They can go on their phone, read, or watch TV while the vehicle steers, brakes, accelerates, and anticipates environmental changes. Drivers should still be ready to take control when necessary. Level 4 Level 4, also called \"mind off,\" is used to describe any vehicle whose automated capabilities allow a driver to be fully disengaged while the vehicle is in operation. In this case, a driver could sleep or even sit in the back or passenger seat of the car. But should be prepared to park the vehicle or retake control once the mapped out journey has ended. Level 5 Level 5, also called \"steering wheel optional,\" refers to any vehicle that does not need a driver at all, a robotic taxi. Sources: https://www.bbc.com/news/business-44159581 https://www.inc.com/kevin-ryan/self-driving-cars-future-5g-cybersecurity.html https://www.theguardian.com/technology/self-driving-cars https://www.wsj.com/articles/self-driving-cars-roll-up-slowly-11576439387 https://www.ucsusa.org/resources/self-driving-cars-101 https://www.caranddriver.com/tesla https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a30795396/gm-super-cruise-self-driving-2023/","wordCount":1106}</script>

    <hr class="sidepanel-seperator">

    <ul class="new-sidepanel-menu"><li class="new-sidepanel-menu-parent-item has-children" data-id="1" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false" aria-label="Subscribe" aria-controls="submenu_subscribe" role="button"><div><a title="Subscribe" href="https://subscribe.hearstmags.com/subscribe/splits/caranddriver/cdb_sub_nav_link?source=cdb_sub_nav_left" target="_blank" >Subscribe</a><span class="sidepanel-submenu-toggle"></span></div>
<ul id='submenu_subscribe' class='new-sidepanel-submenu' data-parent-id='1'>

</li>

		<div class="top-pathing-inner">
							
















<div class="simple-item top-pathing-item show-numbers">

			
			<a href="/news/a32852072/2021-ford-mustang-mach-1-revealed/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Top Touts" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="Ford Mustang Mach 1 Is Back for 2021 with 480 HP" data-vars-ga-position="1" data-vars-ga-total-positions="5">
	
		











<div class="simple-item-image item-image">
						
			<span class="lqip lazyload" data-expand="2000" data-lqip="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mach1-driving-1592231758.gif?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=480:*&amp;frame=1&amp;lqip=yes"></span>

				src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
				data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mach1-driving-1592231758.gif?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=320:*"
				data-sizes="auto"
								data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mach1-driving-1592231758.gif?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=160:* 160w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mach1-driving-1592231758.gif?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=320:* 320w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mach1-driving-1592231758.gif?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=480:* 480w"
			/>
			
					<div class="top-pathing-label">
				Today&#039;s Top Stories
			</div>

			<div class="simple-item-index">

		</div>

	</div>

			<a href="/news/a32869979/2021-lexus-is300-is350-sedan-revealed/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Top Touts" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="2021 Lexus IS Gets Redesign, Handling Upgrades" data-vars-ga-position="2" data-vars-ga-total-positions="5">

<div class="simple-item-image item-image">
						
			<span class="lqip lazyload" data-expand="2000" data-lqip="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/screen-shot-2020-03-09-at-4-45-58-pm-1583786833.png?crop=1.00xw:0.772xh;0,0.139xh&amp;resize=480:*&amp;frame=1&amp;lqip=yes"></span>

<div class="leaderboard-ad "> 
	<div id="gpt-leaderboard-ad"  class="ad-container"></div>
</div>
<div id="piano-newsletter-container"></div>
















<header class="content-header standard-header"><div class="affiliate-disclaimer bar-content-disclaimer  hidden">
	<p class="affiliate-disclaimer-detail">
		Our car experts choose every product we feature. We may earn money from the links on this page.

			</p>
</div>

	
	<div class="content-header-inner">
		<h1 class="content-hed standard-hed">What Is a <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">Self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">Driving</b> Car?</h1>

					<div class="content-dek standard-dek"><p>A <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> car is a type of vehicle that does not need a person to operate it. Instead, It uses advanced sensory technology like lidar, sonar, GPS, radar, or odometry and inertial measurements to identify environmental changes and adapt to restore safe speed or distance.</p></div>
		
		










<div class="content-info standard-info">
	<div class="content-info-metadata">
										



	<div class="byline-with-image">
		<div class="content-info-byline-image" aria-hidden="true">
								
	
						<img class="lazyload lazyimage" alt="" title="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/rover/profile_photos/7ed93866-c605-42c1-9d5d-7130f8c11a4d_1581444597.png?fill=1:1&amp;resize=80:*" data-sizes="auto" data-srcset=""></div>

				<!-- shared/byline -->

	
		




	<div class="byline ">By
					<a class="byline-name" href="/author/224834/car-and-driver-research/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Byline" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="Car and Driver Research"><span class="byline-name">Car and Driver Research</span></a>		
	</div>
<!-- / shared/byline -->

	</div>

		
						<time class="content-info-date" datetime="2020-04-13T14:47:04.720686Z"></time></div>

	</div>

	</div>
</header><div id="piano-content-container"></div>





<div class="content-container standard-container">
	<div class="standard-body">
					









		
		

	<div class="content-lede-image standard-lede-image">
				<div class="content-lede-image-wrap aspect-ratio-freeform" style="padding-bottom:66.6865%">
				
	
						<img class="lazyload lazyimage" alt="Yandex self-driving taxi unveiled in Moscow" title="Yandex self-driving taxi unveiled in Moscow" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?resize=480:*" data-sizes="auto" data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?resize=640:* 640w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?resize=768:* 768w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/navigation-system-at-a-yandex-self-driving-taxi-during-the-news-photo-1585685678.jpg?resize=980:* 980w"><div class="image-credit content-lede-image-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Alexander Ryumin</span><span class="image-copyright">Getty Images</span></div>

					</div>
		
							</div>

		
		<div class="article-body-content standard-body-content">
			<p class="body-text">A <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> car is a type of vehicle that does not need a person to operate it. Instead, It uses advanced sensory technology like lidar, sonar, GPS, radar, or odometry and inertial measurements to identify environmental changes and adapt to restore safe speed or distance.</p><h2 class="body-h2">Are There <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">Self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">Cars</b> Legally in Operation Today?</h2><p class="body-text">According to the Union of Concerned Scientists, as of 2020, there are no fully-autonomous vehicles in legal operation. Instead, <a class="body-link" href="https://www.ucsusa.org/resources/self-driving-cars-101" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.ucsusa.org/resources/self-driving-cars-101">partially-autonomous</a> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b> have become a cutting-edge option in the legal realm. These vehicles have sensory technology that helps drivers maintain lane control, speed, and safe following distance on the road.</p><h2 class="body-h2">What is the History of <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">Self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">Cars</b>?</h2><p class="body-text">The history of <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b> mentioned in the Wall Street Journal goes back to the 1920s, where engineering professionals drew up plans for an <a class="body-link" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/self-driving-cars-roll-up-slowly-11576439387" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.wsj.com/articles/self-driving-cars-roll-up-slowly-11576439387">automated <b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> system (ADS),</a> with experiments starting as early as the 1950s. However, the first automated vehicle was not developed for testing until the 1970s by the Tsukuba Mechanical Engineering laboratory in Japan.</p><p class="body-text">This specially-constructed model had two cameras and an analog computer, which together worked to construct an image of the roadway ahead of them. However, the car only reached 19 miles an hour and it had support from an elevated rail.</p><p class="body-text">Throughout the 1980s the United States' Defense Advanced Research Project Agency (DARPA) funded several university research initiatives involving the development of automated vehicles and their experimentation.</p><p class="body-text">In 1991 the United States gave $650 million in funds towards the National Automated Highway System. This experimental system used special technology placed in the ground to guide automated vehicles along a stretch of road. Despite the program's successful completion in 1997, there was no clear direction for the future of <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b> and their place in transportation.</p><p class="body-text">Fast-forward to 2015, Delphi took <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> to another level. Using Delphi technology, engineers were able to apply improved methods to an Audi model and the vehicle "<b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-drove," over 5,000 miles.</p><h2 class="body-h2">What Are the Differences in Terminology Used to Describe <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">Self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">Cars</b> Within the Industry?</h2><p class="body-text">There are several differences in terminology that experts use to describe <a class="body-link" href="https://www.caranddriver.com/tesla" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.caranddriver.com/tesla"><b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b></a> within the industry, as each organization has its way of defining automated vehicles. The BBC states that these inconsistencies can present certain dangers to the public through confusing or misleading advertisements about a <a class="body-link" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-44159581" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-44159581">new model and its level of autonomy.</a></p><p class="body-text">These are the terms you might come across in your research and how they are different from one another:</p><ul class="body-ul"><li><strong>Autonomous: </strong>Autonomous is used to refer to something that is <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-governing, meaning something that can act on its own without help.</li><li><strong>Autonomous control: </strong>Autonomous control refers to an object's ability to operate solely by itself, using built-in technology to anticipate problems and adjust to prevent them from occurring, without help from an outside force. This term gets used a lot when describing vehicles with <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> capabilities.</li><li><strong>Automated vehicle: </strong>When advertisements describe a car as an automated vehicle, this means that the vehicle can operate by itself for certain periods. However, there are limitations to its autonomy, which means that the driver should be alert and ready to take full control in situations that require manual assistance.</li><li><strong>Fully-Automated vehicle: </strong>When a car is said to be fully-automated, this means that it is fully capable of operating by itself, without the help of the driver.</li></ul><ol></ol><p class="body-text">It is essential to understand the different meanings behind these similar but distinctive terms used to describe <b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> <b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b>, so you can fully understand its limitations.</p><h2 class="body-h2">What is a Classification System in <b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">Driving</b> Automation?</h2><p class="body-text">In <b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> automation, a classification system consists of five levels. These were first established in 2014 by SAE International to help distinguish a <a class="body-link" href="https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a30795396/gm-super-cruise-self-driving-2023/" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a30795396/gm-super-cruise-self-driving-2023/">vehicle's level of autonomy</a>, from fully-manual to fully automated.</p><h2 class="body-h2">What Are the Levels of <b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">Driving</b> Automation?</h2><p class="body-text">The Union of Concerned Scientists outlines the levels of <b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b> automation that distinguish a vehicle's ability to be fully autonomous. Here is each autonomy level and what it means if a vehicle is classified under it:</p><h3 class="body-h3">Level 0</h3><p class="body-text">Level 0 describes any car whose automated system can give drivers warnings about collisions, speed, and other potentially hazardous conditions. However, the driver is in full control of the vehicle at all times.</p><h3 class="body-h3">Level 1</h3><p class="body-text">Level 1 describes any vehicle that shares control with the driver. What this means is any vehicle that has cruise control, parking assistance, or lane assistance. In each case, the driver still needs to operate a portion of the car. With cruise control, they are still responsible for steering and braking when necessary. </p><p class="body-text">With parking assistance, drivers are responsible for applying the correct amount of braking and acceleration. Similarly, lane assistance allows the vehicle to take control of steering to an extent, while the driver is still responsible for maintaining speed and braking when necessary.</p><h3 class="body-h3">Level 2</h3><p class="body-text">Level 2, also called "hands-off," is used to describe any vehicle that is fully capable of operating itself. This includes braking, accelerating, and steering. However, the driver is still responsible for paying attention to their surroundings and should always be prepared to take back control when necessary. Many level 2 vehicles are also programmed only to operate when sensors detect the driver's hands on the steering wheel.</p><h3 class="body-h3">Level 3</h3><p class="body-text">Level 3, also called "eyes off," is used to describe any vehicle whose automated capabilities allow the driver to take their eyes off of the road for extended periods. They can go on their phone, read, or watch TV while the vehicle steers, brakes, accelerates, and anticipates environmental changes. Drivers should still be ready to take control when necessary.</p><h3 class="body-h3">Level 4</h3><p class="body-text">Level 4, also called "mind off," is used to describe any vehicle whose automated capabilities allow a driver to be fully disengaged while the vehicle is in operation. In this case, a driver could sleep or even sit in the back or passenger seat of the car. But should be prepared to park the vehicle or retake control once the mapped out journey has ended.</p><h3 class="body-h3">Level 5</h3><p class="body-text">Level 5, also called "steering wheel optional," refers to any vehicle that does not need a driver at all, a robotic taxi.</p><p class="body-text">Sources:</p><p class="body-text"><a class="body-link" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-44159581" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-44159581">https://www.bbc.com/news/business-44159581</a> </p><p class="body-text"><a class="body-link" href="https://www.inc.com/kevin-ryan/self-driving-cars-future-5g-cybersecurity.html" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.inc.com/kevin-ryan/self-driving-cars-future-5g-cybersecurity.html">https://www.inc.com/kevin-ryan/<b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b>-future-5g-cybersecurity.html</a></p><p class="body-text"><a class="body-link" href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/self-driving-cars" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/self-driving-cars">https://www.theguardian.com/technology/<b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b></a></p><p class="body-text"><a class="body-link" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/self-driving-cars-roll-up-slowly-11576439387" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.wsj.com/articles/self-driving-cars-roll-up-slowly-11576439387">https://www.wsj.com/articles/<b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b>-roll-up-slowly-11576439387</a></p><p class="body-text"><a class="body-link" href="https://www.ucsusa.org/resources/self-driving-cars-101" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.ucsusa.org/resources/self-driving-cars-101">https://www.ucsusa.org/resources/<b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#ffcc99">cars</b>-101</a></p><p class="body-text"><a class="body-link" href="https://www.caranddriver.com/tesla" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.caranddriver.com/tesla">https://www.caranddriver.com/tesla</a></p><p class="body-text"><a class="body-link" href="https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a30795396/gm-super-cruise-self-driving-2023/" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a30795396/gm-super-cruise-self-driving-2023/">https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a30795396/gm-super-cruise-<b style="color:#000;background:#ffff66">self</b>-<b style="color:#000;background:#66ffff">driving</b>-2023/</a></p>


						
						
						<div class="screen-reader-only">
    This content is created and maintained by a third party, and imported onto this page to help users provide their email addresses. You may be able to find more information about this and similar content at piano.io
</div>
<div id="piano-inline"></div>


						<div class="spotim-disclaimer screen-reader-only" style="display:none;">
				This commenting section is created and maintained by a third party, and imported onto this page. You may be able to find more information on their web site.
			</div>

								</div>

		

	</div>

	<div class="content-rail standard-rail">
					<div class="vertical-ad standard-article-vertical-ad">
	<div class="breaker-ad-text">Advertisement - Continue Reading Below</div>
	<div id="gpt-ad-vertical-top" class="ad-container"></div>
</div>

			</div>
</div>

<!-- / shared/article-marketplace-horizontal.twig -->
<!-- shared/end-of-content.twig -->
	<div class="end-of-content-module">
		<div class="eoc-ad"></div>
	</div>
<!-- / shared/end-of-content.twig -->
<!-- shared/module-recommended.twig -->
<div id="module-recommended" class="recommended-module"></div>
<!-- / shared/module-recommended.twig -->
<div id="mobile-adhesion-unit" class="mobile-adhesion-unit open">
	<div id="adAdhesion"></div>
	<button class="mobile-adhesion-unit-close-button"></button>
</div>
<script id="gallery-list-template" type="text/template">
	<div class="gallery-module <%= galleryHideBrands ? 'hide-brands' : '' %> <%= galleryHideVendors ? 'hide-vendors' : '' %> <%= galleryHideProsAndCons ? 'hide-pros-and-cons' : '' %>" role="region" aria-label="carousel" tabindex="0">
		<% if ( !gallerySuppressTitle ) { %>
			<h2 class="title"><%= title %></h2>
		<% } %>
		<div class="gallery-list">
			<% _.each( data, function( item, i ) { %>
				<div class="list-item">
					<% if ( item.data.type == 'product') { %>
						<% var product = item.data.product %>
<a class="clickable-image-link clickable-image-embed-item clickable-image-product-link"
	href="<%= item.data.product.retailer_url %>"
	target="_blank"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-brand="<%= item.data.product.product.brand %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-category="<%= item.data.product.category %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-brand="<%= item.data.product.brand || item.data.product.product.brand %>"
	data-destUrl="<%= item.data.product.retailer_url %>"
	data-id="<%= item.data.mediaId %>"
	data-order="<%= item.id+1 %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-price="<%= item.data.product.price %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-id="<%= item.data.id %>"
	data-vars-ga-media-role="<%= item.data.role %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-id="<%= item.data.product.product.sem3_id %>"
	data-vars-ga-outbound-link="<%= item.data.product.outboundLink %>" 
	aria-label="<%= item.data.product.action %> <%= item.data.product.name %>">
		<img class="list-product-slide-image" srcset="<%= item.data.product.image.src %>"/>
</a>

<div class="list-product-slide-info">
	<% if (item.data.product.name) { %>
		<div class="product-headline">
			<%= item.data.product.name %>
		</div>
	<% } %>
	<div class="product-slide-details">
		<% if (item.data.product.brand) { %>
			<span class="product-slide-brand"><%= item.data.product.brand %></span>
		<% } %>
		<% if (item.data.product.vendor) { %>
			<span class="product-slide-vendor"><%= item.data.product.vendor %></span>
		<% } %>
		<% var itemOnSale = product.item_on_sale && !1; %>
<% var listPrice = product.list_price %>
<% var price = product.price %>
<% var discount = product.discount %>
<% if (product.show_price && product.priceNoSymbol > 0) { %>
	<span class="product-slide-price">
		<% if (itemOnSale) { %>
			<span aria-label="Original Price " tabindex="0" class="list-price text-strike"><%= listPrice %></span>
			<div aria-label="Sale Price   percent off" tabindex="0" class="discount-price text-bold">
				<%= price %> (<%= discount %>% off)
			</div>
		<% } else { %>
			<%= price %>
		<% } %>
	</span>
<% } %>

	</div>
	<div class="embedded-product-button-wrapper">
		<div class="product-buy-button-wrapper">
	
<%
	var product = product
	var brand = product.product.brand
	var cta = product.action || "SHOP NOW"
	var href = product.retailer_url
	var outboundLink = product.outboundLink
	var item_on_sale = product.item_on_sale
	var productBrand = product.brand || brand
	var productPrice = product.price
	var sem3Id = product.product.sem3_id
	var productId = product.id
%>

<% var role = item.data.role %>
<% var link_treatment = item_on_sale ? "sale" : "" %>

<a class="product-btn-link"
	href="<%= href %>"
	data-href="<%= href %>"
	data-vars-ga-call-to-action="<%= cta %>"
			data-vars-ga-link-treatment="<%= link_treatment %>"
		data-vars-ga-media-role="<%= role %>"
	data-vars-ga-outbound-link="<%= outboundLink %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-brand="<%= productBrand %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-id="<%= productId %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-price="<%= productPrice %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-brand="<%= brand %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-category="<%= product.category %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-id="<%= sem3Id %>"
	data-vars-ga-media-type="product_review"
	data-vars-ga-ux-element="Product Button"
	target="_blank"
	rel="nofollow"><%= cta %></a>

</div>

	</div>
	<% if (item.data.product.description) { %>
		<div class="dek"><%= item.data.product.description %></div>
	<% } %>
	</div>

					<% } else if ( item.data.type == 'product_review') { %>
						<% if (!_.isUndefined(item.data.media)) { %>
	<img class="list-product-slide-image" src="<%= item.data.media.src %>"/>
<% } %>

<div class="list-product-slide-info">
	<% if (item.data.content_product_review.headline) { %>
		<div class="product-headline">
			<%= item.data.content_product_review.headline %>
		</div>
	<% } %>
	<div class="product-slide-details">
		<% if (item.data.content_product_review.brand) { %>
			<span class="product-slide-brand"><%= item.data.content_product_review.brand %></span>
		<% } %>
		<% if (item.data.content_product_review.retailer) { %>
			<span class="product-slide-vendor"><%= item.data.content_product_review.retailer %></span>
		<% } %>
	</div>
		<%
		var seals = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.product_seal
				? item.data.content_product_review.product_review.product_seal.seals
				: '';
	%>
	<% var today = new Date(); %>
<% _.each(seals, function(seal) { %>
    <% if (today < Date.parse(seal.contract_end_date)) { %>
    <a class="product-review-seal" href="https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/institute/about-the-institute/a31680/good-housekeeping-seal-faqs/">
      <img src="<%= seal.type.image %>" alt="<%= seal.type.name %>"/>
    </a>
  <% } %>
<% }); %>

	<% var showPrice = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.show_price && (item.data.content_product_review.product_review.retailer.price > 0 || item.data.content_product_review.product_review.product.is_custom) %>
<% var itemOnSale = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.retailer.item_on_sale && !1 %>
<% var listPrice = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.retailer.listprice_formatted %>
<% var price = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.retailer.price_formatted %>
<% var discount = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.retailer.discount %>

<% if (showPrice) { %>
	<div class="product-slide-price">
		<% if (itemOnSale) { %>
			<span aria-label="Original Price " tabindex="0" class="list-price text-strike"><%= listPrice %></span>
				<div aria-label="Sale Price   percent off" tabindex="0" class="discount-price text-bold">
				<%= price %> (<%= discount %>% off)
			</div>
		<% } else { %>
			<%= price %>
		<% } %>
	</div>
<% } %>

	<div class="embedded-product-button-wrapper">
	<div class="product-buy-button-wrapper">
	
<%
	var brand = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.product.brand
	var cta = item.data.content_product_review.call_to_action || "SHOP NOW"
	var product = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.product
	var href = item.data.content_product_review.retailer_url
	var outboundLink = item.data.content_product_review.outbound_retailer_url
	var item_on_sale = item.data.content_product_review.product_review.retailer.item_on_sale
	var productBrand = item.data.content_product_review.brand
	var productPrice = parseFloat(Math.round(product.retailers[0].price * 100) / 100).toFixed(2)
	var sem3Id = product.sem3_id
	var productId = item.data.content_product_review.id
%>

<% var role = item.data.role %>
<% var link_treatment = item_on_sale ? "sale" : "" %>

<a class="product-btn-link"
	href="<%= href %>"
	data-href="<%= href %>"
	data-vars-ga-call-to-action="<%= cta %>"
			data-vars-ga-link-treatment="<%= link_treatment %>"
		data-vars-ga-media-role="<%= role %>"
	data-vars-ga-outbound-link="<%= outboundLink %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-brand="<%= productBrand %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-id="<%= productId %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-price="<%= productPrice %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-brand="<%= brand %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-category="<%= product.category %>"
	data-vars-ga-product-sem3-id="<%= sem3Id %>"
	data-vars-ga-media-type="product_review"
	data-vars-ga-ux-element="Product Button"
	target="_blank"
	rel="nofollow"><%= cta %></a>

</div>

	</div>
	<% if (item.data.content_product_review.summary) { %>
		<div class="dek"><p><%= item.data.content_product_review.summary %></p></div>
	<% } %>
</div>

					<% } else { %>
						<div class="list-item-image-wrap">
							<% if ( item.data.clickable_image_url ) { %>
								<a class="clickable-image-link clickable-image-embed-item"
									href="<%= item.data.clickable_image_url %>" target="<%= item.data.clickable_image_target %>"
									data-id="<%= item.data.mediaId %>" data-destUrl="<%= item.data.clickable_image_url %>"
									data-order="<%= item.id+1 %>" data-role="<%= item.data.role %>"
									<% if (item.data.clickable_image_nofollow) { %>
										rel="<%= item.data.clickable_image_nofollow %>"
									<%  } %> >
									<img class="list-image" src="<%= item.data.media.src %>" srcset="
										<% _.each( item.data.media.srcset, function( srcset, i ) { %>
										<%= srcset.img %><% if (i !== item.data.media.srcset.length ) { %>, <% } %>
										<% }); %>
									">
								</a>
							<% } else { %>
								<img class="list-image" src="<%= item.data.media.src %>" srcset="
									<% _.each( item.data.media.srcset, function( srcset, i ) { %>
									<%= srcset.img %><% if (i !== item.data.media.srcset.length ) { %>, <% } %>
									<% }); %>
								">
							<% } %>
						</div>

						<div class="list-info">
						<% if ( item.data.headline ) { %>
								<div class="item-info-title" role="heading" aria-level="3"><%= item.data.headline %></div>
							<% } %>
							<% if ( item.data.dek ) { %>
								<%= item.data.dek.replace(/<p>/g, '<p class="item-info-dek">') %>
							<% } %>
						</div>
					<% } %>
				</div>
			<% }); %>
		</div>
	</div>
</script>




	<div class="transporter">
		<div class="transporter-header" role="heading" aria-level="2">
			<div class="transporter-header-inner">
								<span class="transporter-label">More From</span>
									<a class="transporter-hed" href="/research/">Research</a>

		</div>

			<a href="/research/a32758614/electric-cars-pros-and-cons/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Transporter" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="Electric Cars: Pros and Cons" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.caranddriver.com/research/a32758614/electric-cars-pros-and-cons/" data-vars-ga-position="5" data-vars-ga-total-positions="11">

<div class="simple-item transporter-simple-item ">

			
			<a href="/research/a32758625/how-many-miles-does-a-car-last/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Transporter" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="How Many Miles Does a Car Last?" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.caranddriver.com/research/a32758625/how-many-miles-does-a-car-last/" data-vars-ga-position="6" data-vars-ga-total-positions="11">
	
		











<div class="simple-item-image item-image">
						
	
						<img class="lazyload lazyimage" alt="" title="Toyota&#x20;And&#x20;Honda&#x20;Top&#x20;List&#x20;Of&#x20;Most&#x20;Fuel-Efficient&#x20;Cars"
				src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"
				data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/view-from-inside-a-toyota-prius-hybrid-vehicle-while-news-photo-1591212028.jpg?crop=1xw:0.76844xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"
				data-sizes="auto"
								data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/view-from-inside-a-toyota-prius-hybrid-vehicle-while-news-photo-1591212028.jpg?crop=1xw:0.76844xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:* 480w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/view-from-inside-a-toyota-prius-hybrid-vehicle-while-news-photo-1591212028.jpg?crop=1xw:0.76844xh;center,top&amp;resize=640:* 640w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/view-from-inside-a-toyota-prius-hybrid-vehicle-while-news-photo-1591212028.jpg?crop=1xw:0.76844xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:* 768w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/view-from-inside-a-toyota-prius-hybrid-vehicle-while-news-photo-1591212028.jpg?crop=1xw:0.76844xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:* 980w"
			/>
			
			
</div>


		
	
		
	
		








	



<div class="simple-item-title item-title">How Many Miles Does a Car Last?</div>

		

		
		
	
			</a>
	</div>


																														
						
																																			
													
			
















<div class="simple-item transporter-simple-item grid-simple-item-last-mobile grid-simple-item-last-tablet ">

			
			<a href="/research/a32758751/lease-with-option-to-buy/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Transporter" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="Lease With Option to Buy" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.caranddriver.com/research/a32758751/lease-with-option-to-buy/" data-vars-ga-position="7" data-vars-ga-total-positions="11">

<script id="recirc-module-template" type="text/template">
	<div class="recirculation-module">
		<div class="recirculation-module-header">
			More From

			<a class="recirculation-module-feed-link" href="<%= data.feed.url %>"><%= data.feed.title %></a>
		</div>

		<div class="recirculation-module-inner">
			<% _.each( data.content, function( item, index ) { %>
				<div class="simple-item recirculation-module-item">
					<a
						href="<%= item.url %>"
						data-vars-ga-ux-element="Right Rail"
						data-vars-ga-call-to-action="<%= _.escape(item.title) %>"
						data-vars-ga-position="<%= index + 1 %>"
						data-vars-ga-total-positions="<%= data.content.length %>"
					>
						<div class="recirculation-module-image">
							<% if ( item.image ) { %>
								<div class="full-item-image item-image recirculation-image">
									

<img alt="" class="lazyload lazyimage" data-src="<%= item.image.src %>"
	<% if ( typeof item.image.srcset !== "undefined" && item.image.srcset.length ) { %>
		data-srcset="<%= item.image.srcset.join(",") %>"
	<% } %>
/>


									<%
	var displayTypeTitle = item.displaytype._attributes.title;
	var contentTypeTitle = item.contenttype._attributes.title;

	var contentTypeIcon = {
		"Quizzes": "quiz",
		"Video": "play"
	}[ contentTypeTitle ];

	var displayTypeIcon = {
		"Gallery": "gallery"
	}[ displayTypeTitle ];

	var acceptedContentTypes = contentTypeTitle === "Quizzes" || contentTypeTitle === "Video";
	var acceptedDisplayTypes = displayTypeTitle === "Gallery";

	var showIcons = acceptedContentTypes || acceptedDisplayTypes;
%>

<% if ( showIcons ) { %>
	<div class="content-type-icon">
		<i class="icon icon-<% if ( contentTypeIcon ) { %><%= contentTypeIcon %><% } else { %><%= displayTypeIcon %><% } %>"></i>
	</div>
<% } %>

								</div>
							<% } else { %>
								<div class="recirculation-content-indicator">
									<% if ( item && item.hasOwnProperty( "displayType" ) ) { %>
	<%
		var iconClass = {
			"Gallery": "gallery",
			"Listicle": "list",
			"Long Form Article": "feature"
		}[ item.displayType ] || "article";
	%>
	<span class="content-indicator  icon icon-<%= iconClass %>"></span>
<% } %>

								</div>
							<% } %>
						</div>

						<span class="item-title recirculation-module-item-title"><%= item.title %></span>
					</a>

					<% if ( item.sponsor ) { %>
							

<%
	var sponsorClass = {
		"1": "no-logo",
		"2": "presented-by",
		"3": "brand-logo",
		"4": "provided-by",
		"5": "created-for",
		"6": "custom-label"
	}[ item.sponsor.type ],
	siteName = item.sitename,
	customLabelLong = item.sponsor.custom_label_long,
	customLabelShort = item.sponsor.custom_label_short;
%>

<% if ( sponsorClass != "no-logo" ) { %>
	<div class="sponsor sponsor-inline simple-item-sponsor recirculation-sponsor <%= sponsorClass %>">
		<div class="sponsor-label">
			<% if ( sponsorClass === "brand-logo" ) { %>
					<span class="site-name"><%= siteName %></span>
			<% } else if ( sponsorClass === "created-for" ) { %>
				<span class="created-for--short" >
					Created for
				</span>

				<span class="created-for--long" >
					Created by <%= siteName %> for
				</span>
			<% } else if ( sponsorClass === "custom-label" ) { %>
				<span class="custom-label--short" >
					<%= customLabelShort %>
				</span>

				<span class="custom-label--long" >
					<%= customLabelLong %>
				</span>
			<% } else { %>
				<% if ( sponsorClass === "presented-by" ) { %>
					Presented by
				<% } %>

				<% if ( sponsorClass === "provided-by" ) { %>
					Created by
				<% } %>
			<% } %>
		</div>
		<% if ( sponsorClass === "brand-logo" ) { %>
			<span class="sponsor-logo-separator">+ </span>
		<% } %>
		<div class="sponsor-image">
			<%= item.sponsor.brand %>
		</div>
			</div>
<% } %>

					<% } %>
				</div>
			<% } ); %>
		</div>
	</div>
</script>
<script id="cars-for-sale-template" type="text/template">
    <iframe
        data-src="<%= moduleUrl %>?make=<%= make %>&model=<%= model %>&inventory=<%= inventoryPartner %>&zip=<%=zip%>&source=<%= source %>"
        frameborder="0"
        width="100%"
        scrolling="no"
        overflow="hidden"></iframe>
</script>
<script id="related-module-template" type="text/template">
	<a class="related-content-link" href="<%= data.url %>">
		<div class="embed-related-content" data-related-id="<%= data.id %>" data-tracking-id="recirc-editorial" data-tracking-label="<%= data.title %>">
			<div class="image-container aspect-ratio-2x1">
				<% if ( data.image ) { %>
					

<img alt="" class="lazyload lazyimage" data-src="<%= data.image.src %>"
	<% if ( typeof data.image.srcset !== "undefined" && data.image.srcset.length ) { %>
		data-srcset="<%= data.image.srcset.join(",") %>"
	<% } %>
/>

				<% } else { %>
					<% if ( item && item.hasOwnProperty( "displayType" ) ) { %>
	<%
		var iconClass = {
			"Gallery": "gallery",
			"Listicle": "list",
			"Long Form Article": "feature"
		}[ item.displayType ] || "article";
	%>
	<span class="content-indicator  icon icon-<%= iconClass %>"></span>
<% } %>

				<% } %>
			</div>
			<div class="info-container">
				<a class="item-title recirculation-module-item-title" href="<%= data.url %>"><%= data.title %></a>
			</div>
		</div>
	</a>
</script>
<script id="gallery-module-template" type="text/template">
	<div class="gallery-module <%= galleryHideBrands ? 'hide-brands' : '' %> <%= galleryHideVendors ? 'hide-vendors' : '' %> <%= galleryHideProsAndCons ? 'hide-pros-and-cons' : '' %>" data-gallery-id="<%= galleryId %>" data-gallery-slide-count="<%= data.length %>"
	role="region" aria-label="carousel" tabindex="0">
		<% if ( !gallerySuppressTitle ) { %>
			<h2 class="title"><%= title %></h2>
		<% } %>
		<div class="gallery-slide">
			<div class="slides">
				<div class="slides-inner">
					<% _.each( data, function( item, i ) { %>
						<div class="slide">
							<figure>
								<% if ( item.data.type == 'file' ) { %>
									<div class="loop" aria-label="<%= item.data.headline %>" tabindex="-1">
										<video data-src="<%= item.data.src %>" autoplay loop muted playsinline></video>
									</div>
								<% } else if ( item.data.type == 'video' ) { %>
									<div class="video" aria-label="<%= item.data.headline %>" tabindex="-1">
										<iframe src="<%= item.data.src %>" title="Video embed"></iframe>
									</div>
								<% } else if ( item.data.type == 'embed' && item.data.media.embed_type == 'youtube' ) { %>
									<div class="youtube" aria-label="<%= item.data.headline %>" tabindex="-1">
										<% if (!isAdsFree) { %>
											<%= item.data.media.lazy_embed_code %>
										<% } %>
									</div>
								<% } else if (!_.isUndefined(item.data.media)) { %>
									<div class="image">
										<img data-src="<%= item.data.media.src %>" data-srcset="
											<% _.each( item.data.media.srcset, function( srcset, i ) { %>
												<%= srcset.img %><% if (i !== item.data.media.srcset.length ) { %>, <% } %>
											<% }); %>
										" alt="<%= item.data.headline %>" tabindex="-1">
									</div>
								<% } %>
								<figcaption>
									<% if (data.length > lowSlideCount) { %>
										<p class="index"><%= i + 1 %><span class="index-text">of</span><%= data.length %></p>
									<% } %>
									<% if ( item.data.headline ) { %>
										<p class="headline"><%= item.data.headline %></p>
									<% } %>
									<% if ( item.data.dek ) { %>
										<%= item.data.dek.replace(/<img(.*?)>/g, '').replace(/<p>/g, '<p class="dek">') %>
									<% } %>
									<% if ( item.data.credit ) { %>
										<p class="credit"><%= item.data.credit %></p>
									<% } %>
									<% if ( item.data.copyright ) { %>
										<p class="copyright"><%= item.data.copyright %></p>
									<% } %>
								</figcaption>
							</figure>
						</div>
					<% }); %>
				</div>
				<ul class="actions">
					<li class="next" role="button" aria-label="next slide" tabindex="0"></li>
					<li class="previous" role="button" aria-label="previous slide" tabindex="0"></li>
				</ul>
			</div>
			<div class="caption" tabindex="0"></div>
			<% if (data.length <= lowSlideCount) { %>
				<div class="dots" role="navigation">
					<% _.each( data, function( item, i ) { %>
						<div class="dot<% if (i === 0) { %> active<% } %>" role="button" aria-label="jump to slide <%= i + 1 %>" tabindex="0" ><%= i + 1 %></div>
					<% }); %>
				</div>
			<% } %>
		</div>
		<% if (data.length > lowSlideCount) { %>
			<div class="thumbnails">
				<ul class="actions" role="navigation">
					<li class="previous" role="button" aria-label="previous thumbnails frame" tabindex="0"></li>
					<li class="next" role="button" aria-label="next thumbnails frame" tabindex="0"></li>
				</ul>
				<div class="thumbnails-inner">
					<% _.each( data, function( item, i ) { %>
						<div class="slide<% if (i === 0) { %> active<% } %>" role="button" aria-label="go to slide <%= i + 1 %>" tabindex="0">
							<% if (!isAdsFree || item.data.type != 'embed') { %>
								<img class="lazyload" data-src="<%= item.data.thumb.src %>" alt=""/>
							<% } %>
						</div>
					<% }); %>
				</div>
			</div>
		<% }%>
</script>





<script id="eoc-playlist-template" type="text/template" data-section-id="8a04a812-7380-44ee-86ae-dd5968962c2d">
		<div class="end-of-content-playlist" >
			<div class="video-header">
				<h2 class="watch-next-header" data-wn-label-body="More from Car and Driver" >
					Watch Next
				</h2>
				<p class="video-title"></p>
			</div>

			<div id='watch-next-player'>
				


<div class="embed-wrapper iframe-wrapper" >
	<div class="glimmerPlayer extend-preroll-timeout media-loader lazyload"
		data-align=""
		data-media-id=""
		data-player-id="<%= data.embed_id %>"
		data-size=""
		data-autoplay="true"
		data-muted="true"
		data-sticky="true"
		data-sticky-container=""
		data-sharing="false"
		
		
		
								data-dock="false"
		
				>
			</div>
</div>

			</div>
		</div>
</script>

				</main>

			<script id="deferred-css-script-tag">( function( d, Modernizr ) {
	d.addEventListener( "DOMContentLoaded", function() {
		var l, h = d.getElementsByTagName( "head" )[ 0 ],
		f = ["https://assets.hearstapps.com/sites/caranddriver/assets/css/standard-article.bf11bed.css"],
		m = ["https://assets.hearstapps.com/sites/caranddriver/assets/css/standard-article-mobile.adeb448.css"];

		for ( var i = 0, len = f.length; i < len; i++ ) {
			l = d.createElement( "link" );
			l.rel = "stylesheet";
			l.href = Modernizr && Modernizr.mobile ? m[ i ] : f[ i ];

			h.parentNode.insertBefore( l, h );
		}
	} );
} )( document, Modernizr );

( function( d ) {
	const search = window.location.search;
	const ua = navigator.userAgent;
	if (~search.indexOf('disableTagManager') && (~ua.indexOf('Chrome-Lighthouse') || ~ua.indexOf('PTST')) ) return;
	const head = document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
	const s = document.createElement( "script" );
	s.async = true;

	
		window.GDPR_CONSENT_MODAL = function() {
				let oneTrustModalIsShowing = document.getElementById("onetrust-banner-sdk") ? true : false;

		return oneTrustModalIsShowing;
	};

			s.src = "//nexus.ensighten.com/hearst/autos/Bootstrap.js";
			
	if ( d.cookie.indexOf( "nsghtn=dev" ) > -1 ) {
		s.src = "//nexus.ensighten.com/hearst/autos-dev/Bootstrap.js";
	}

			head.appendChild( s );
	} )( document );
</script>
		</body>
	</html>

</div>
